bug.author: ns1123
bug.summary: Improve the error message when there is no alluxio worker
bug.description: Alluxio Version: What version of Alluxio are you using? Affects all current versions Describe the bug A clear and concise description of what the bug is. Currently, if there is no worker registered to the master, when the user performs a write operation, they see the below error. "There is no worker with enough space for a new block of size {0}" Similarly for reads, users see: "Block {0} is unavailable in both Alluxio and UFS." To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior (as minimally and precisely as possible) Start an Alluxio cluster with no workers and attempt a read/write operation Expected behavior A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. A new error message should be thrown on any non-metadata operation clearly detailing that there are no workers registered to the cluster. Urgency Describe the impact and urgency of the bug. High Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.
